title: Linux
content:
This page has information on how to install and use GoCV on Linux.
Installing Using

title: What Is GoCV
content:
The GoCV package provides Go language bindings for the OpenCV 3 computer vision library.
GoCV supports the latest release of OpenCV (v3.3) on Linux, OS X, and (soon) Windows. We hope to make the Go programming language a “first-class” client compatible with the latest developments in the OpenCV ecosystem.
GoCV also supports the Intel Computer Vision SDK using the Photography Vision Library (PVL).

title: OS X
content:
This page has information on how to install and use GoCV on OS X.
Installing Using

title: Getting Started
content: To use GoCV, you must first install OpenCV 3.3 on your system. We have instructions for Ubuntu, OS X, and Windows.

title: What Is OpenCV
content: OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library: http://opencv.org) is an open-source BSD-licensed library that includes several hundreds of computer vision algorithms.

title: Windows

This page will have information on how to install and use GoCV on Microsoft Windows 10.

title: GoCV
content:
Welcome to GoCV 
 GoCV is a Go language package for computer vision using OpenCV 3.3.
